net.fec.openrq

Class SBDInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fec.openrq.SBDInfo

  • public final class SBDInfo
extends Object
    This class represents information about a source block decoder that can be conveyed to an encoder, in order to help decide which symbols are prioritized for encoding.

    When a back communication channel is available from a receiver to a sender of data, information about a specific source block may be useful in determining how the source block is encoded by the sender. For example, such information may contain a list with the identifiers of the missing source symbols at the receiver, so that the sender can know which symbols it needs to transmit.

    This class offers the following information:

    • Source Block Number: the identifier of the source block
    • Decoder State: a flag indicating if the source block is incomplete, decoded or if it suffered a decoding failure
    • Missing Source Symbols: a list with the identifiers of all missing source symbols at the decoder
    • Available Repair Symbols: a list with the identifiers of all repair symbols that were received by the decoder

    Methods are provided to write instances of this class to arrays of bytes, ByteBuffer objects, serializable objects, DataOutput objects and WritableByteChannel objects. Additionally, static methods are provided to parse/read instances of this class from arrays of bytes, ByteBuffer objects, serializable objects, DataInput objects and ReadableByteChannel objects.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static Parsed<SBDInfo> parse(SerializableSBDInfo serInfo,
                    FECParameters fecParams)
        Parses source block decoder information from the given serializable object.

        The provided FEC parameters are used to validate the information during the parsing.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the information can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        serInfo - A serializable object containing source block decoder information
        fecParams - FEC parameters associated to the source data containing the source block being decoded
        Returns:
        a container object containing a SBFInfo instance or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If any argument is null

      • parse

        public static Parsed<SBDInfo> parse(byte[] array,
                    FECParameters fecParams)
        Parses source block decoder information from the given array. The information bytes in the array must follow the format specified by asArray().

        The information will be read, in the array, from position 0 inclusive to position array.length exclusive.

        The provided FEC parameters are used to validate the information during the parsing.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the information can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        array - An array of bytes containing source block decoder information
        fecParams - FEC parameters associated to the source data containing the source block being decoded
        Returns:
        a container object containing source block decoder information or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If any argument is null

      • parse

        public static Parsed<SBDInfo> parse(byte[] array,
                    int off,
                    int len,
                    FECParameters fecParams)
        Parses source block decoder information from the given array. The information bytes in the array must follow the format specified by asArray().

        The information will be read, in the array, from position off inclusive to position (off + len) exclusive.

        The provided FEC parameters are used to validate the information during the parsing.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the information can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        array - An array of bytes containing source block decoder information
        off - The starting index in the array (must be non-negative)
        len - The length of the information (must be non-negative and no larger than array.length - off)
        fecParams - FEC parameters associated to the source data containing the source block being decoded
        Returns:
        a container object containing source block decoder information or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the pre-conditions on the array offset and length do not hold
        NullPointerException - If any argument is null

      • parse

        public static Parsed<SBDInfo> parse(ByteBuffer buffer,
                    FECParameters fecParams)
        Parses source block decoder information from the given buffer. The information bytes in the buffer must follow the format specified by asBuffer().

        The information will be read, in the buffer, from the current position inclusive to the current limit exclusive. If the parsing succeeds, the position of the buffer will have been advanced by the number of bytes read.

        The provided FEC parameters are used to validate the information during the parsing.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the information can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        buffer - A buffer containing source block decoder information
        fecParams - FEC parameters associated to the source data containing the source block being decoded
        Returns:
        a container object containing source block decoder information or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If any argument is null

      • readFrom

        public static Parsed<SBDInfo> readFrom(DataInput in,
                       FECParameters fecParams)
                                throws IOException
        Reads and parses source block decoder information from a DataInput object. The read information bytes must follow the format specified by writeTo(java.io.DataOutput).

        Examples of DataInput objects are DataInputStream and ObjectInputStream.

        The provided FEC parameters are used to validate the information during the parsing.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the information can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until the whole information is read from the input, or a parsing failure is detected, or an IOException is throw.

        Parameters:
        in - A DataInput object from which source block decoder information is read
        fecParams - FEC parameters associated to the source data containing the source block being decoded
        Returns:
        a container object containing source block decoder information or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the DataInput object
        NullPointerException - If any argument is null

      • readFrom

        public static Parsed<SBDInfo> readFrom(ReadableByteChannel ch,
                       FECParameters fecParams)
                                throws IOException
        Reads and parses source block decoder information from a ReadableByteChannel object. The read information bytes must follow the format specified by writeTo(java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel).

        Examples of ReadableByteChannel objects are SocketChannel and FileChannel.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the information can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until the whole information is read from the channel, or a parsing failure is detected, or an IOException is throw.

        Parameters:
        ch - A ReadableByteChannel object from which source block decoder information is read
        fecParams - FEC parameters associated to the source data containing the source block being decoded
        Returns:
        a container object containing source block decoder information or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the ReadableByteChannel object
        NullPointerException - If any argument is null

      • sourceBlockNumber

        public int sourceBlockNumber()
        Returns the identifier of the source block being decoded.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the source block being decoded

      • state

        public SourceBlockState state()
        Returns the latest state of the source block being decoded.

        The result of this method invocation is a SourceBlockState value:

        INCOMPLETE:
        means that not enough encoding symbols are available for a decoding operation.
        DECODED:
        means that a decoding operation took place and succeeded in decoding the source block.
        DECODING_FAILURE:
        means that a decoding operation took place but failed in decoding the source block; additional encoding symbols are required for a successful decoding.
        Returns:
        the latest state of the source block being decoded

      • missingSourceSymbols

        public Set<Integer> missingSourceSymbols()
        Returns an unmodifiable set of integers containing the encoding symbol identifiers of the missing source symbols from the source block being decoded.
        Returns:
        a set of encoding symbol identifiers of missing source symbols

      • availableRepairSymbols

        public Set<Integer> availableRepairSymbols()
        Returns an unmodifiable set of integers containing the encoding symbol identifiers of the available repair symbols for decoding.
        Returns:
        a set of encoding symbol identifiers of available repair symbols

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Returns true if, and only if, this instance is equal to another object.

        This instance (this) is equal to another object (obj), if and only if:

        • obj is non-null
        • and obj is an instance of SBDInfo
        • and this.sourceBlockNumber() == obj.sourceBlockNumber()
        • and this.state().equals(obj.state())
        • and this.missingSourceSymbols().equals(obj.missingSourceSymbols())
        • and this. availableRepairSymbols().equals(obj.availableRepairSymbols())
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • asSerializable

        public SerializableSBDInfo asSerializable()
        Returns a serializable object with this information encoded in a compact format (the same format as of method asArray()).
        Returns:
        a serializable object with this information encoded in a compact format

      • asArray

        public byte[] asArray()
        Returns an array with this information encoded in a compact format.

        Let:

        • NUM_MISSING_BYTES = 2 × missingSourceSymbols().size()
        • NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES = 3 × availableRepairSymbols().size()

        The array will contain the source block number, followed by a byte value corresponding to the latest state of the source block, followed by NUM_MISSING_BYTES, followed by the list of the encoding symbol identifiers (ESIs) of the missing source symbols, followed by NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES, followed by the list of the ESIs of the available repair symbols.

        Returns:
        an array with this information encoded in a compact format

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(byte[] array)
        Writes in the provided array starting at index zero this information encoded in a compact format.

        Let:

        • NUM_MISSING_BYTES = 2 × missingSourceSymbols().size()
        • NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES = 3 × availableRepairSymbols().size()

        The write consists of the source block number, followed by a byte value corresponding to the latest state of the source block, followed by NUM_MISSING_BYTES, followed by the list of the encoding symbol identifiers (ESIs) of the missing source symbols, followed by NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES, followed by the list of the ESIs of the available repair symbols.

        The provided array must have a length of at least (7 + NUM_MISSING_BYTES + NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES) bytes.

        Parameters:
        array - An array on which the information is written
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the length of the array is insufficient to hold the information
        NullPointerException - If the provided array is null

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(byte[] array,
           int offset)
        Writes in the provided array starting in a specific index this information encoded in a compact format.

        Let:

        • NUM_MISSING_BYTES = 2 × missingSourceSymbols().size()
        • NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES = 3 × availableRepairSymbols().size()

        The write consists of the source block number, followed by a byte value corresponding to the latest state of the source block, followed by NUM_MISSING_BYTES, followed by the list of the encoding symbol identifiers (ESIs) of the missing source symbols, followed by NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES, followed by the list of the ESIs of the available repair symbols.

        The provided array must have at least (7 + NUM_MISSING_BYTES + NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES) bytes between the given index and its length.

        Parameters:
        array - An array on which the information is written
        offset - The starting array index at which the information is written (must be non-negative)
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the offset is negative or if the length of the array region starting at the offset is insufficient to hold the information
        NullPointerException - If the provided array is null

      • asBuffer

        public ByteBuffer asBuffer()
        Returns a buffer with this information encoded in a compact format.

        Let:

        • NUM_MISSING_BYTES = 2 × missingSourceSymbols().size()
        • NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES = 3 × availableRepairSymbols().size()

        The buffer will contain the source block number, followed by a byte value corresponding to the latest state of the source block, followed by NUM_MISSING_BYTES, followed by the list of the encoding symbol identifiers (ESIs) of the missing source symbols, followed by NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES, followed by the list of the ESIs of the available repair symbols.

        Returns:
        a buffer with this information encoded in a compact format

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Writes in the provided buffer this information encoded in a compact format.

        Let:

        • NUM_MISSING_BYTES = 2 × missingSourceSymbols().size()
        • NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES = 3 × availableRepairSymbols().size()

        The write consists of the source block number, followed by a byte value corresponding to the latest state of the source block, followed by NUM_MISSING_BYTES, followed by the list of the encoding symbol identifiers (ESIs) of the missing source symbols, followed by NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES, followed by the list of the ESIs of the available repair symbols.

        The provided buffer must not be read-only, and must have at least (7 + NUM_MISSING_BYTES + NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES) bytes remaining. If this method returns normally, the position of the provided buffer will have been advanced by the same amount.

        Parameters:
        buffer - A buffer on which the information is written
        Throws:
        ReadOnlyBufferException - If the provided buffer is read-only
        BufferOverflowException - If the provided buffer has less than (7 + NUM_MISSING_BYTES + NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES) bytes remaining
        NullPointerException - If the buffer is null

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(DataOutput out)
             throws IOException
        Writes this information encoded in a compact format directly into the provided DataOutput object.

        Let:

        • NUM_MISSING_BYTES = 2 × missingSourceSymbols().size()
        • NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES = 3 × availableRepairSymbols().size()

        The method will write the source block number, followed by a byte value corresponding to the latest state of the source block, followed by NUM_MISSING_BYTES, followed by the list of the encoding symbol identifiers (ESIs) of the missing source symbols, followed by NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES, followed by the list of the ESIs of the available repair symbols.

        Examples of DataOutput objects are DataOutputStream and ObjectOutputStream.

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until the whole information is written to the output, or an IOException is throw.

        Parameters:
        out - A DataOutput object into which the information is written
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the DataOutput object
        NullPointerException - If out is null

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(WritableByteChannel ch)
             throws IOException
        Writes this information encoded in a compact format directly into the provided WritableByteChannel object.

        Let:

        • NUM_MISSING_BYTES = 2 × missingSourceSymbols().size()
        • NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES = 3 × availableRepairSymbols().size()

        The method will write the source block number, followed by a byte value corresponding to the latest state of the source block, followed by NUM_MISSING_BYTES, followed by the list of the encoding symbol identifiers (ESIs) of the missing source symbols, followed by NUM_AVAILABLE_BYTES, followed by the list of the ESIs of the available repair symbols.

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until the whole information is written to the channel, or an IOException is throw.

        Parameters:
        ch - A WritableByteChannel object into which the information is written
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the WritableByteChannel object
        NullPointerException - If ch is null
